rules: Rule1: Under the condition that a person has a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.
Rule2: If a person is an expert in a technology, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
Rule3: Either a person is an expert in a technology or a person is a novice in a technology.
Rule4: Supposing a person is a novice in a technology, then if that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
Rule5: In the event that a person is a mentor to another person, that person teaches the other person.
Rule6: A person is a mentor to another person or a person is a student of another person.
Rule7: Should a person be a student of another person, that person learns from the other person.
Rule8: Assuming a person learns from another person, then whenever that person replaces a tool, the person has the tool.
Rule9: If a person is a manager of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.
Rule10: Provided that a person is a coordinator of an event, then if it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then the person does not succeed at the event.
Rule11: In the case that a person is a director of an event, then either that person is a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.
Rule12: A person is a director of an event or a person is a supervisor of an event.
Rule13: Whenever a person is a supervisor of an event, that person leads the event.
Rule14: If a person leads an event, then that person is either a manager of the event or a coordinator of the event.
Rule15: Supposing a person designs furniture, then that person creates furniture.
Rule16: Given that a person manufactures furniture, then that person designs furniture.
Rule17: If a person attends an event, then if it is not the case that using a technology implies manufacturing furniture, then the person fails at the event.
Rule18: In the event that a person repairs a tool, it is not the case that the person breaks the tool.
Rule19: A person repairs a tool or a person replaces a tool.
Rule20: In the case that it is not the case that replacing a tool implies not breaking the tool, then a person succeeds at the event.
Rule21: Under the condition that an event is not a workshop, a person uses a technology.
Rule22: Provided that an event is not a workshop, a person breaks a tool.
facts: Fact1: A person attends an event.
Fact2: A person does not teach another person.
Fact3: It is not the case that a person creates furniture.
Fact4: A person does not fail at an event.
